solution_line_template: There are {seconds_per_minute} seconds per minute, so Jackie's push-up routine takes {total_minutes} * {seconds_per_minute} = <<{seconds_per_minute}={total_seconds_in_minute}>>{total_seconds_in_minute} seconds.
She can do a push-up in {time_for_pushups} / {num_pushups} = <<{time_for_pushups}/{num_pushups}={time_per_pushup}>>{time_per_pushup} seconds.
Therefore, Jackie can do {pushup_time} / {time_per_pushup} = <<{pushup_time}/{time_per_pushup}={total_pushups}>>{total_pushups} push-ups in one minute with breaks.
